Findings Report on the Tor Browser Bundle User Experience Project

On the http://l7plhliaaob6puqw.onion/. If you are not using Tor, it can be accessed via the tor2web service at http://l7plhliaaob6uqw.tor2web.org. Although with tor2web, our anonymity isn't compromised while yours is.

This site contains the Findings Report concluding an ISC project focused on reviewing and redesigning the user experience (UX) for the Tor Browser Bundle.

It was initially prompted by the feedback from participants of the April 2013 event sponsored by the ISC in Washington DC. We hope you find the materials useful, and look forward to feedback, as user experience is about the user, and is the compulsory starting point for any software project.

We are hoping that UX gains centrality in all anonymity/circumvention/privacy projects, as no solution is adequate if the user base is limited by its accessibility on any level.

  • COMING SOON Click here to view the HTML version of the Findings Report.
  • Click here to download the PDF file of the report, although note that this shouldn't be considered safe or anonymous activity.

COMING SOON Comments should be directed to...

This site contains no Javascript, Java, cookies, Flash, ActiveX nor any other type of code or data that will waste cycles on your computer.
pageTitle: Findings Report on the Tor Browser Bundle User Experience Project
